post_text:
Reminder: Sessions for parents and the community are tomorrow and Wednesday.
Staff heard Dr. G speak today and found it extremely helpful and engaging. Bring any questions you may have, or send them in advance so Dr. G can make sure to address them during his presentation. Look forward to seeing you there!

post_text:
Teachers and staff are learning a lot to get ready for school, and you can too! Mark your calendars and join the Region One community for this engaging and informative session with Dr. G, a practicing pulmonologist at Johns Hopkins.
Have questions about COVID-19 for Dr. G? Message us to have them added to the Q&A!

post_text:
Tuesday, August 18th- 11:30- Summer Reading Wrap Up Party with Mrs. Sam! ‚Äî Story Time and picnic! ‚ÄúKnighthood‚Äù Prizes will be distributed, and the special raffle prizes will be drawn! Bring your own picnic so we can lay out our blankets at a safe social distance but still be ‚Äútogether‚Äù. This program will be hosted outside, on the library lawn. Be sure to turn in your summer reading grids to collect your prizes!
#imagineyourstory2020 #imagineyourstory #librariestransform #librariesrocküìö #sharonct #ctlibraries

post_text:
Hello Sharon Center School Students and Families!

The school year is almost upon us and, like you, we are getting ready.

Will you help us?

One thing we are doing to get ready is making some videos.

This is where we need help from YOU!

We want students to be a part of welcoming everyone back to school. If you are willing to participate in our Region One is Back! Video, please click the link below to access our Flipgrid- which will collect the videos, and has directions for what to do.

We would love to have as many students involved as possible, but we need to put everything together, so we are asking you to submit any video message you want to share no later than Friday, August 21.

https://flipgrid.com/f764d63e
(password is Region1Schools if you need one)

We can't wait to see your smiling faces!

post_text: The Sharon Center School Community Meeting will be held virtually at 5 pm on Monday, August 3, 2020. Sharon Center School Principal Dr. Karen Manning, the Sharon Center school Leadership Team, Superintendent Lisa Carter and Assistant Superintendents Scott Fellows and Jill Pace will present a view of Sharon Center School in the fall of 2020. The target audience for this group is parents and caregivers. All interested community members are welcome to attend. We will ask that questions be submitted via the chat box and that microphones are off during the meeting. We hope you can attend!
shared_text:

The Sharon Center School Community Meeting will be held virtually at 5 pm on Monday, August 3, 2020. Sharon Center School Principal Dr. Karen Manning, the Sharon Center school Leadership Team, Superintendent Lisa Carter and Assistant Superintendents Scott Fellows and Jill Pace will present a view of Sharon Center School in the fall of 2020. The target audience for this group is parents and caregivers. All interested community members are welcome to attend. We will ask that questions be submitted via the chat box and that microphones are off during the meeting. We hope you can attend!

MON, AUG 3
Sharon Center School Community Meeting

Such a wonderful morale booster today!!
We loved seeing our students and their families at our Wave Parade!!
We extend a HUGE thank you to all who participated!! Special thanks to the fire department for leading the parade with 2 fire trucks, and to Judge Manning for sending a horse trailer to be part of the parade!!
text:
Such a wonderful morale booster today!!
We loved seeing our students and their families at our Wave Parade!!
We extend a HUGE thank you to all who participated!! Special thanks to the fire department for leading the parade with 2 fire trucks, and to Judge Manning for sending a horse trailer to be part of the parade!!

post_text: Just a reminder for Sharon Center School families that this is a DRIVE BY ONLY parade- students are expected to remain in their vehicle at all times. Please do NOT walk to town for the parade. Only SCS staff will be outside of their vehicle. This is to respect social distancing protocols so everyone can remain safe. Thank you!! We look forward to seeing you!
text: Just a reminder for Sharon Center School families that this is a DRIVE BY ONLY parade- students are expected to remain in their vehicle at all times. Please do NOT walk to town for the parade. Only SCS staff will be outside of their vehicle. This is to respect social distancing protocols so everyone can remain safe. Thank you!! We look forward to seeing you!

Sharon Center School
April 27 at 1:06 PM ¬∑

Hi Everybody!! I cannot tell you how excited I am to deliver the AMAZING artwork that you all made to the Sharon Hospital. I am SO BLOWN AWAY by the TALENT and the amount of EFFORT that you all put into this. I have compiled the work into banners that will be hung in the hospital. I really am so proud and honored to be a part of the Sharon Center School community! Here is a link to the album with all of the images as well as the banners! - Mrs. Barnett https://www.icloud.com/sharedalbum/#B0NGrq0zwG9UbXQRegion One School District

text: We are all in this together ‚ù§Ô∏è

post_text:
We are announcing Region One Unity!

We are united in our quest to provide all of the support we can to our students, staff, and families in Region One.

We are asking staff, students, parents, and community members to place any kind of heart (paper, fabric, wood, etc.) on any place that can be seen by others-- your mailbox, inside of your car, your home-- so that everyone who sees a heart will know that our region is very strong. We are showing our strength in so many ways.

It's pretty simple. When you then leave your home for food or take a safe walk in the neighborhood, you can smile, when you see the hearts, knowing that we are all in this together.

#Region1Unity
Region One School District
text:
We are announcing Region One Unity!

We are united in our quest to provide all of the support we can to our students, staff, and families in Region One.

We are asking staff, students, parents, and community members to place any kind of heart (paper, fabric, wood, etc.) on any place that can be seen by others-- your mailbox, inside of your car, your home-- so that everyone who sees a heart will know that our region is very strong. We are showing our strength in so many ways.

It's pretty simple. When you then leave your home for food or take a safe walk in the neighborhood, you can smile, when you see the hearts, knowing that we are all in this together.

#Region1Unity
Region One School District

post_text: As we move towards the weekend, don't forget that breakfast and lunch are available at no cost to you and are delivered to bus stops on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. These meals are available to any SCS student and any siblings under the age of 18. Any SCS family can take advantage of this offer. We would love to serve more families! Call the office or email kmanning@sharoncenterschool.org to get signed up!

post_text:
The Early Kindergarten and Kindergarten have begun a group snack program called Feed your mind! This project has been supported by a grant from the Sharon School Millenium Fund of Berkshire Taconic Community Foundation.
The goals of this program are to increase healthy eating habits by tasting healthy snacks together daily and helping to prepare and serve foods. We hope to encourage kids to taste new fruits, veggies, dairy/proteins and to reduce trash due to less individual packaging (Ind. packaging in pictures are a donation).
We are looking for a sustaining donor for this program to continue into the next school year and beyond. Please share with anyone you think may be interested in helping with this! Contact our Kdg teacher
Allison Bryant: abryant@sharoncenterschool.org
text:
The Early Kindergarten and Kindergarten have begun a group snack program called Feed your mind! This project has been supported by a grant from the Sharon School Millenium Fund of Berkshire Taconic Community Foundation.
The goals of this program are to increase healthy eating habits by tasting healthy snacks together daily and helping to prepare and serve foods. We hope to encourage kids to taste new fruits, veggies, dairy/proteins and to reduce trash due to less individual packaging (Ind. packaging in pictures are a donation).
We are looking for a sustaining donor for this program to continue into the next school year and beyond. Please share with anyone you think may be interested in helping with this! Contact our Kdg teacher
Allison Bryant: abryant@sharoncenterschool.org

post_text:
We had our first annual winter festival this afternoon! It was an exciting half day with crafts, challenges, games and stories. The best part was that our groups were all mixed grades. Our kids love being with their younger and older schoolmates! We saw so much cooperation and teamwork. We ended our day with a sing-along and a visit from some friendly snow people bearing candy.
We had lots of students and staff wearing ‚Äúugly‚Äù and festive attire, even our kindergarten elf wore an ugly sweater. What a way to kick off our winter break!Region One School District

post_text: We all know there are many talented individuals here at SCS. Over the weekend I attended a Chorus Angelicus concert my daughter was in. Our own Mrs. Ellington directs one of the groups. I am always blown away by her group. Just one of the many things your teachers do outside of the school day...... (please excuse the poor video quality, I was trying to be discreet.....).

post_text: Day 3 in Washington DC - we visited Arlington Cemetery, toured the Smithsonian Air and Space Museum, shopped and lunched at Union Station, saw a play at Fords Theatre, and had a guided tour of the DC monuments (many thanks to Jennifer Epstein) to finish out the evening. Plus we celebrated Margot‚Äôs birthday :)
